segments.text: Welcome to the show. Today we have a special guest.
Thank you for having me. It's great to be here.
Let's start with your background in artificial intelligence.
I've been working in AI for about fifteen years now.
I started at a research lab focused on natural language processing.
We were building some of the earliest transformer models.
That must have been an exciting time in the field.
It really was. Nobody knew how big this would become.
The breakthroughs came faster than anyone expected.
What do you think is the most important development recently?
I'd say the scaling laws paper was a turning point.
It showed that bigger models consistently perform better.
But there are diminishing returns at some point.
We need to be smarter about how we train these systems.
Efficiency is becoming just as important as scale.
What about the safety concerns people raise?
Safety is absolutely critical. We can't ignore it.
I believe we need both technical and policy solutions.
The industry is starting to take this more seriously.
Thank you so much for sharing your insights today.
My pleasure. Thanks for the great questions.
